input.content: Please answer the following question using only a single letter on your reply.
There's a building with 5 floors and 5 windows per floor. At night, every third window of every floor is lit and the others are off. Which letter of the alphabet do the lit windows look like?
Please answer the following question using only a single letter on your reply.

There's a building with 5 floors and 5 windows per floor. At night, every leftmost window of every floor is lit. All the top floor windows are also lit. All the bottom floor windows are also lit. All the others are off. Which letter of the alphabet do the lit windows look like?
Please answer the following question using only a single letter on your reply.

There's a building with 5 floors and 5 windows per floor. At night, every leftmost window of every floor is lit. All the top floor windows are also lit. All the bottom floor windows are also lit. All the rightmost windows are also lit. All the others are off. Which letter of the alphabet do the lit windows look like?
Please answer the following question using only a single letter on your reply.

There's a building with 5 floors and 5 windows per floor. At night, every leftmost window of every floor is lit. All the bottom floor windows are also lit. All the others are off. Which letter of the alphabet do the lit windows look like?
Please answer the following question using only a single letter on your reply.

There's a square parking lot with 5 parking slots on each side. There are 5 cars parked on the north side, 5 cars parked on the west side and 5 cars parked on the south side. Looking from above, which letter of the alphabet do the cars form?
Please answer the following question using only a single word on your reply.
There are 5 men side by side. On top of those men's shoulders, 4 men stand. On top of those 4 men's shoulders, 3 men stand and so on. What 2D geometric shape do they form?
Please answer the following question using only a single word on your reply.

There are 5 men side by side. On top of those men's shoulders, 5 men stand. On top of those 5 men's shoulders, another 5 men stand so on until they have reached a pile 10 men high. What 2D geometric shape do they form?
Please answer the following question using only a single letter on your reply.

At the half time break, a large group of cheerleaders enter a football field from the side. 20 of them form a row along the east 40 yard line. 20 others form a row along the west 40 yard line. 20 more form a horizontal row connecting the previous 2 rows by crossing the center field mark. Looking from above, which letter of the alphabet do they form?
Please answer the following question using only a single letter on your reply.

At the half time break, 60 cheerleaders enter a football field from the side. 20 of them form a row exactly along the east 40 yard line. 20 others form a row exactly over the west 40 yard line. 20 more form a horizontal row connecting the previous 2 rows at the south end of them. Which letter of the alphabet do they form?
Please answer the following question using only a single letter on your reply.

At the half time break, 40 cheerleaders enter a football field from the side. They all meet at the center of the field and each one hold hands with other 2. After every one of them have hold hands, they spread out equally spaced until they all have their arms fully extended but are still holding hands. Which letter of the alphabet do they form?
Please answer the following question using only 'Left' or 'Right' words in a JSON list format

There's a maze formed by 5 concentric circles. The innermost circle has a door to the north and all the other circles have doors at 90 degrees to the right of the immediately inner circle. A person stands inside the innermost circle, facing the door to the north. Which turns does she have to make to reach the exit?
Please answer the following question using only 'Left' or 'Right' words in a JSON list format

There's a maze formed by 5 concentric squares. The innermost square has a door to the north and all the other squares have doors at 90 degrees to the left of the immediately inner square. A person stands inside the innermost square, facing the door to the north. Which turns does she have to make to reach the exit?
Please answer the following question using only 'Left' or 'Right' words in a JSON list format
A person stands in front of the entrance to a 'U' shaped corridor. The first turn is to the right. At the end of the corridor there's an exit. Which turns does she have to make to reach the exit?

A person stands in front of the entrance to a 'L' shaped corridor The first turn is to the right. At the end of the corridor there's an exit. Which turns does she have to make to reach the exit?

A person stands in front of the entrance to a 'C' shaped corridor The first turn is to the left. At the end of the corridor there's an exit. Which turns does she have to make to reach the exit?
